description.summary: A fairy child left in place of a stolen human child. Changelings were believed to explain infant illness, developmental disorders, and postpartum conditions before modern medicine.
description.full: A changeling is a fairy offspring that has been secretly left in place of a human child, typically an infant. According to folklore, fairies would steal healthy human babies and replace them with their own children, who would appear sickly, strange in behavior, fail to develop normally, eat voraciously, or have an unnaturally old appearance. This belief was widespread in Celtic and Germanic folklore and tragically led to child abuse and deaths when parents used cruel tests to 'reveal' or banish the supposed changeling. Modern understanding recognizes that changeling beliefs were used to explain conditions like autism, Down syndrome, developmental delays, and other medical conditions before modern medicine.

etymology.origin: From Old English 'changeling' - one who has been changed or exchanged
etymology.meaning: A child that has been exchanged or substituted

related_phenomena.name: Fairies
related_phenomena.description: Supernatural beings who steal children and leave changelings

appearance.description: Unusually large head, small body, or other physical anomalies
Wrinkled or ancient-looking face despite being a baby

physical.morphology: Appears as a human infant but with unusual features suggesting otherworldly origin

abilities.description: May speak with adult wisdom or know things no infant should know
Eating far more than normal child, never satisfied

patterns: Doesn't respond to parents like normal child
May suddenly reveal true nature when tested

signs: Child doesn't grow or develop at normal rate

tests.name: Eggshell brewing
tests.description: Brew beer or cook in eggshells - changeling will exclaim surprise, revealing age

tests.name: Fireplace test
tests.description: Threaten to put child in fireplace - changeling will flee up chimney
tests.notes: DANGEROUS - led to actual child deaths

tests.name: Exposure test
tests.description: Leave child in wild - fairies will return real child
tests.notes: DANGEROUS - led to actual child deaths

reversal_methods: Make changeling reveal itself (may cause fairies to return real child)
Threaten the changeling (fairies may exchange it back)
Show extreme cruelty (changeling flees, fairies return real child)
Appeal to fairy court or priest

beliefs: Fairies want healthy human children to strengthen their bloodline
Fairies must pay tithe to Hell every seven years (Scottish belief)
Unbaptized children are vulnerable to fairy theft
Iron and salt protect against changeling substitution
Fairies prefer beautiful or talented children

historical_impact.description: Changeling beliefs had tragic real-world consequences
consequences: Abandonment of disabled or ill children
Documented court cases of parents killing 'changelings'
Delayed medical treatment for genuine conditions

famous_cases.name: Bridget Cleary
famous_cases.description: Woman killed by husband who believed she was changeling

cultural_sensitivity.note: Changeling beliefs represent a dark chapter in European folk tradition with real victims
considerations: Recognize historical harm to disabled and neurodivergent children
Understand as historical explanation for medical conditions
Respect memory of actual victims of changeling beliefs
Distinguish folklore study from endorsement of practices

psychological_function: Provided narrative for parental grief or disappointment
Coping mechanism for disability in pre-medical era
Excused parental rejection of difficult children

range.description: Primarily Celtic and Germanic regions of Europe

cultural_spread.notes: Belief spread with European colonization but primarily European phenomenon

origins.cultural_roots: Ancient Celtic and Germanic fairy traditions
origins.folklore_connections: Part of broader fairy folklore and belief in supernatural child theft
